title: 'I spent my family's savings on taking TalkTalk to court over equal pay'
text:
An intense pain travelled slowly up Rebecca Burke’s back and into her chest. She took a painkiller and carried on work as a project director, but it soon became difficult to breathe. When she got home, the pain was so intense that she thought she was having a heart attack and her husband, James, called for an ambulance to rush her to Frimley Park Hospital.

Months later, after multiple tests and similar incidents, doctors told Burke it was in fact a panic attack.

“I didn’t believe it to begin with,” says Burke. “It felt too physical to be psychological.”

Burke led TalkTalk’s cybersecurity programme after it was hacked in 2015 in a nationwide scandal, which cost the company £77 million and landed...
description: An intense pain travelled slowly up Rebecca Burke’s back and into her chest.
